greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period-lengths of the base-2 MR-expansions of the reciprocals of the positive integers.
comment: It appears that if p is a prime with 2 as a primitive root (A001122), then a(p)=(p-1)/2. This has been confirmed for primes up to 2000. See A136042 for the definition of the MR-expansion of a positive real number.
example: In A136042 it is shown that the base-2 MR-expansion of 1/5 is {3,1,3,1,3,1,3,1,...}, with period-length 2, so a(5)=2.
results.author: _John W. Layman_, Dec 12 2007
